doc.field: This series traces Thomas Moran's involvement in three New York State Supreme Court cases: Ostrowski v. Local 1-2 (1980), State of New York v. Consolidated Edison, Inc. (1982-1986) and Moran v. Vaccaro (1989). The documents in this series span a variety of phases of the cases' progress through the courts, including briefs from plaintiffs and defendants at multiple injunctions, correspondence between the New York State Attorney General's office and plaintiffs, and plaintiff affidavits. The initial letter to the plaintiffs in Moran v. Vaccaro and the forms accompanying the letter, including a questionnaire for plaintiffs surveying their medical history and details of exposure, is a significant document that frames much of the surrounding legal documentation although no completed questionnaires are included. A written statement from Richard Ostrowski, shop steward for Local 1-2, on his illegal removal from stewardship in retaliation for organizing around issues of radiation exposure, is also included.
